SBE576.Description of CMU Components: The CMU will initially consist of 7.5 MWe / 10 MWth gas fired CHP plant based at an Energy Centre in Bedminster, South Bristol.  The project will export power to the grid and will also involve the laying and construction of a district heating network that will connect to up to 1000 residential dwellings and a selection of commercial and industrial units.  There will be scope to increase the electrical output to 12 MWe - but this will not be implemented as part of the first phase.

SCU002.Description of CMU Components:
The CMU is a 52MW/52MWh Lithium Iron Battery Electric Storage System. The BESS is co-located with a solar PV plant, and shares a grid connection, but is separately metered. The solar and the BESS will be registered as separate BMUs. The Electricity Storage Facility will connect to the grid via the 132/33 kV substation of the Facility, connecting to additional panels on the 33 kV switchgear. 
The main assets, elements and systems forming the Electricity Storage Facility are: 
26 containers with Lithium Ion battery modules (LFP), containers are furthermore including HVAC, fire extinguishing system and controls; 
13 PCS skids, each comprising of 2x 2000 kVA converter, a 4 MVA 0.8/33 kV step up transformer and a 630A 33 kV Ring Main Unit (RMU)
SCU002.Location and Post Code:
Land North East of Eastfield Farm, Hutton Cranswick, East Riding of Yorkshire YO25 9RB (address in planning application)
Scurf Dyke Farm, Cranswick, YO25 9RD (address of grid connection point)
SCU002.Company Name: FP LUX SCURF DYKE SOLAR LIMITED

SEL125.Description of CMU Components: Thurrock Power Limited has secured a "blue chip" manufacturer as the EPC contractor to engineer, procure and construct a gas power facility on at land at Walton Common north of the National Grid Substation, Fort Road, Tilbury, RM18 8UL.. Thurrock Power Limited will be constructed to be a brand new generating asset and is expected to have an equipment design life of 20 years.  An experienced Operations & Maintenance contractor will be employed to ensure the plant is running effectively and efficiently to meet Capacity Market requirements.  An Independent technical expert will be engaged to confirm the Plant will meet the Extended Years Criteria, Financial Commitment Milestone, and 6 monthly report for the Delivery Body as required under paragraph 8.3.6A of the Capacity Market Rules.
SEL125.Location and Post Code: land at Walton Common north of the National Grid Substation, Fort Road, Tilbury, RM18 8UL.

SRHA07.Description of CMU Components: Battery energy storage system (1c rating, NMC lithium ion) comprising eight inverters with nominal power output rating of 2.0MW each (16.0MW total). The connection capacity of the BESS has been declared as being 10.000MW instead of the distribution connection agreement capacity of 16.000MW for the purposes of calculating extended performance. The connection capacity of 10.000MW is a conservative estimate for the available battery capacity at the end of the CM delivery year 2028/29, using engineering judgement to take into account projected battery degradation and system performance at that time.
SRHA07.Location and Post Code: BRLR, land east of Redhouse electricity substation, Heatherywood Road, Kirkcaldy, Fife, KY1 3NW.

STAF01.Description of CMU Components:
Energy from waste facility located in Staffordshire - Postcode WV10 7DF. This plant was commissionned at the beginning of 2014.  It is a municipal waste incineration plant. It is based on two boilers supplying steam to one turbine-generator. Exhaust steam is condensed in a Air cooled condenser. The site normally operates at baseload. The auxiliary load is self supplied by the generator prior to export metering.  The power factor used is 0.85 for this CMU.
